content.description: About 20' off the ground is a flake/block through a short steep wall.  Getting stood over this section is the first crux.  A second crux is found further up getting past a licheny face to easier ground.  Once the route is cleaned up a bit this may not be too bad.
content.protection: A variety of trad gear from small to medium pretty much protects the route adequately.  There is no fixed gear but great bomber placements at the top for belay.
content.location: The route starts pretty much at the left side of the main face (almost dead center of the overall crag photo) below an obvious flake/block about 20' up.  Climb easy ground up to the flake/block and continue up past the block.  Instead of continuing up the small crack system above, step up and right to onto a whitish slabby face capped with a diagonal crack system.  Follow this up to easier ground to the top.  Walk off west (left facing rock) and follow a rocky stream bed down to slabs.

content.description:
Same start as Unshaven and Just Pull It.  Climb through the crux and immediatley step across to the right wall.  Follow the delicate flake system that trends up and right.  Careful when placing pro in the flake as it is fragile on the edges.  After exiting the flake, you'll hit a bomber horizontal crack that can take a variety of cams from 3" all the way down to a .5".  Continue straight up from there trending left of the small tree on top (Stay left of 'Tree Line").

Walk-off or rap-off.  There are some slings/rap rings to the left once topped out.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3" (plenty of opportunity to place small nuts or micro-cams)
content.location: Left side of Upper Cliffs (aka Sunset Cliff).

content.description: Access Approved 5.7 or so. depending which way you start it. Left side of the cliff,as u walk up from the trail it puts you right there. Gear anchor on top, walk off climber right. Saw tat/slings for Rap..but looked super beat up.. chose walk off. 5.9 var as well as u move past 1st ledge area. pulled from Josh Hornaiks North Tahoe A Rock Climbers Guide
content.protection: Trad, no bolts, gear anchor on top. lots of options. walk off climbers right
content.location:
to right of Get me up 5.8 +. on the left side of the cliff. The trail takes u right to the base.

ascend some blocks to a corner, lip, ledge then to a awesome short hand crack, take it to the summit~~
